record.title: ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 5, 2008
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 5, 2008 -- (Senate - February 04, 2008)

[Page: S612]

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 10 a.m. tomorrow, Tuesday, February 5; and that following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day; that there then be a period for the transaction of morning business for up to 60 minutes, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each and the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees, with the Republicans in control of the first half and the majority in control of the final half; that following morning business, the Senate

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, it is the leader's intention to seek unanimous consent to resume consideration of the FISA legislation tomorrow and have votes on several of the remaining amendments to the bill. Therefore, Senators should be aware that rollcall votes will occur throughout the day.
